"All right," says Bruckner, "if no one will volun-teer, I'll go alone." The rest of you help positionthe Vertacraft over the crevasse and wish him wellas he snaps the hatch shut and releases the craftinto free-fall. Hank Crouter, Bruckner's assistant, glances athis watch. "If he survives, we'll get a signal backwithin ten minutes," he says. You all wait anxiously, watching the clock,watching the crevasse. Ten minutes go by, fifteen,twenty, twenty-five. A chilling wind bites throughyour parka. You kick the icy ground. "Thirty minutes," says Crouter. "There's noway . . ." Weary and sad, your party trudges back acrossthe ice fields. The moving glacier is rapidly closingthe crevasse. There won't be another chance.

The End
